menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Encrypted|1:Encrypted
41:Sensor Rest|42:Sensor Motion|11:Ignition Off Rest|12:Ignition On Motion|21:Ignition On Rest|22:Ignition On Motion|1A:Fake Tow|16:Tow|
0:Stop Charging|1:Charging
0:Unknow|1:Detected|2:Removed|3:Inserted|4:Locked Pin|5:Locked PUK|
0: No Searching|1: Registered|2: Searching|3: Denied|4: Unknown|5: Roaming|
0: No Searching|1: Registered|2: Searching|3: Denied|4: Unknown|5: Roaming|6: Only Local SMS|7: Only Roaming SMS|8: Registration of Emergency Services|
0: Deactivated|1: Activating|2: Activated|3: Deactivating|
0: Initial|1: Idle|2: Activating|3: Connecting|4: Sending|5: Reset|
0: Closed|1: Opened|
0: Connected|1: Disconnected|3: Unknown|
0: GPGSV|1: GLGSV|2: BDGSV|
Reserved|Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input 6|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
Digital output 1|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
0: Read|1: Send|
0: Normal IO|1: Function IO|2: Interrupt IO|
0: Input|1: Output|
0: Low level|1: High Level|
0: Disable Pull|1: Enable Pull|
0: Pull Down|1: Pull Up|
0: Disable BLE Chip|1: Enable BLE Chip|
0: BG22C224|1: BLUENRG345|

menu2.name: BSI (Bearer Setting Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBSI is used to configure the EGPRS/LTE parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 00: No authentication/Auto. (LTE & EGPRS)|01: No authentication/EGPRS only|02: No authentication/LTE only|03: No authentication/EGPRS First. (LTE & EGPRS)|10: PAP authentication/Auto. (LTE & EGPRS)|11: PAP authentication/EGPRS only|12: PAP authentication/LTE only|13: PAP authentication/EGPRS First. (LTE & EGPRS)|20: CHAP authentication/Auto. (LTE & EGPRS)|21: CHAP authentication/EGPRS only|22: CHAP authentication/LTE only|23: CHAP authentication/EGPRS First. (LTE & EGPRS)|30: PAP or CHAP authentication/Auto. (LTE & EGPRS)|31: PAP or CHAP authentication/EGPRS only|32: PAP or CHAP authentication/LTE only|33: PAP or CHAP authentication/EGPRS First. (LTE & EGPRS)
menu3.Description: Mobile network mode of the device: 0: Auto (LTE First & EGPRS). 1: EGPRS only. 2: LTE only. 3: EGPRS First. (LTE & EGPRS). Mobile APN Authentication method of the device: 0: No authentication 1: PAP authentication 2: CHAP authentication 3: PAP or CHAP authentication

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Cat-M1 & Cat-NB2 (Cat-M1 First)|1: Cat-NB2 & Cat-M1 (Cat-NB2 First)|2: Cat-M1|3: Cat-NB2|4: Cat-NB2 first |5: Cat-NB2 only

menu2.name: SRI (Backend Server Registration Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSRI is used to configure where and how to report all the messages, including the server information and the method of communication between the backend server and the device. When the device is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode
0: Disable|1: Low priority|2: High priority|5: Timestamp priority

0: The backend server does not reply with a SACK message when receiving a message from the device.|1: The backend server replies with a SACK message when receiving a message from the device.|2: The backend server replies with a SACK message when receiving a message from the device, but the device does not check the serial number of the SACK message.
0: ASCII|1: HEX|

menu3.Description: 0: The device will send the ACK confirmation using the mode specified by <Report Mode>|1: The device will send the ACK confirmation via SMS to the phone number from which the command is sent via SMS|

menu2.name: QSS (Quick Start Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTQSS is used to configure the EGPRS/LTE parameters and backend server information if the length of all these settings is less than 160 bytes.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode
0: Disable|1: Low priority |2: High priority|5: Timestamp priority
0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|

menu2.name: CFG (Global Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCFG command is used to configure the global parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the odograph function to calculate the total mileage|
Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|network data|Mileage|Send Time|Device Name|
0: Disable|1: GNSS Deep Saving Mode|2: GNSS Low Saving Mode
0: Each time the device is powered on, the LED will work 30 minutes and then turn off|1: The LED turns on as configured
0: Disable|1: Enable the device information report|

00:disable corresponding report|10:Report the current position (+RESP:GTLBC) when the device receives SMS position request message via SMS|20:Report the current position with Google Maps link through SMS to the original number when the device receives SMS Position Request message via SMS.
0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: 0: When the main power supply is connected, the backup battery is charged as needed.1: When the main power supply is connected, the backup battery is only charged after ignition on is detected. The charge process will begin 3 minutes after the ignition is turned on and stop when the ignition is turned off.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the AGPS function|1: Enable the AGPS function|

00: Do not allow the cell information report.|40: Allow the cell information report after failing to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|80: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM after getting GNSS position successfully every time if cell information is available.|C0: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM no matter whether it is successful to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|&+RESP:GTRTL|+RESP:GTLBC|+RESP:GTFRI / +RESP:GTERI|+RESP:GTSOS|+RESP:GTTOW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|

menu2.name: PIN (Auto-unlock PIN)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPIN is used to configure the Auto-Unlock PIN function of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not unlock SIM-PIN automatically.1: Each time the device is powered on, it will detect whether the SIM card is locked with a PIN. If it is locked, the device will unlock the PIN automatically.

menu2.name: TMA (Time Adjustment)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTMA is used to adjust the local time on the device remotely.

menu2.name: OWH (Outside Working Hours)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWH is used to define the working hours and the working mode to protect the privacy.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|3: Automatic mode
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function|3: Automatic mode. The device will automatically check the current time against the working hours range. If it is outside working hours, the device will hide the location information in the ASCII format report message and replace the location information with a fixed value in the hex format report message. If it is during working hours, the location information will be reported normally.

menu2.name: DOG (Protocol Watchdog)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDOG is used to reboot the device in a time based manner or upon ignition.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Reboot Periodically|2: Ignition Reboot|
0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: PDS (Settings for Preserving Device’s Specified Logic States)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPDS is used to preserve specified logic states of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function.|1: Preserve specified logic states according to the value of <Mask>.|2: Reset all the specified logic states listed in <Mask> after receiving the command, and then preserve specified logic states according to the value of <Mask>.

0: States of GEO|1: Reserved|2: Reserved|3: Information of last known position|4: State of ignition|5: State of wave shape 1|6: State of digital input|7: State of SPD|8: State of SSR|9: State of main power|10: State of PEO|

menu2.name: UPC (Over-the-air Configuration Update)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUPC is used to download configuration file over the air for the update of the local configuration.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
0: Disable|1: Enable.|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0:UPC.|1:EUC |
Ignition Off|Ignition On|

menu2.name: HRM (HEX Report Mask)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTHRM command consists of <+ACK Mask>, <+RSP Mask>, <+EVT Mask>, <+INF Mask> and <+HBD Mask> to control the composition of the corresponding HEX report message.

menu3.RangeMx: Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|Reserved|

Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Network Data|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Motion Status|Satellites in Use|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Network Data|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Motion Status|Satellites in Use|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

|Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number|INF Expansion Mask|+RESP:GTVER|Reserved|+RESP:GTGPS|+RESP:GTBAT|+RESP:GTCID|+RESP:GTCSQ|+RESP:GTTMZ|+RESP:GTGIR
+RESP:GTGSV|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTCML|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTBTI|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTSCS|Reserved|+RESP:GTRSV|INF Expansion2 Mask|
Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|UID|
Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|

Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Altitude|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

menu2.name: FRI (Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFRI is used to configure the parameters of fixed report (+RESP:GTFRI).

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable.|1:Fixed Time Report.|2:Fixed Distance Report. |3:Fixed Mileage Report. |4:Optimum Report.|5:Fixed Time or Mileage Report.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function.|1: Fixed Time Report. The position report message is sent to the backend server periodically according to the parameter <Send Interval>.|2: Fixed Distance Report. |3: Fixed Mileage Report. |4: Optimum Report. The device simultaneously checks both time interval and path length between two adjacent position reports.|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report. It checks either time interval or path length between two adjacent reports.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Enable report.|1: Disable report.
0: Do not compress GNSS location report|1: Compress GNSS location report
Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|for the <Bluetooth Accessory Data> field in the message+RESP:GTERI|

menu2.name: FFC (Frequency Change of Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFFC is used to change the parameters of fixed report when certain event occurs, so that different report interval requirements can be met.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the parameters of the specified priority|1: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into any of the defined Geo-Fence|2: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into known roaming state. |3: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into unknown roaming state.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the parameters of the specified priority|1: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into any of the defined Geo-Fence|2: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into known roaming state. (Please refer to the AT+GTRMD command for more information.)|3: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into unknown roaming state.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Fixed Distance Report|3: Fixed Mileage Report|4: Optimum Report|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not change the working mode|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Change the working mode to “Fixed Distance Report”|3: Change the working mode to “Fixed Mileage Report”|4: Change the working mode to “Optimum Report”|5: Change the working mode to “Fixed Time or Mileage Report”|

menu2.name: Tow (Tow Alarm Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTOW is used to configure the sensitivity of the motion sensor and the tow alarm parameters.

menu2.name: GEO (Geo-Fence Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGEO is used to configure the parameters of a Geo-Fence (Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service).

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the zone’s circular Geo-Fence function.|1: Entering the zone. The device will send the report +RESP:GTGIN to the server when it detects that vehicle enters the Geo-Fence area.|2: Exiting the zone. The device will send the report +RESP:GTGOT to the server when it detects that vehicle exits the Geo-Fence area.|3: Report the +RESP:GTGIN and +RESP:GTGOT when entering and exiting the Geo-Fence zone respectively.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable auto trigger mode.|21: Automatically set up a Geo Fence after the ignition is turned off|22: Manually enable Geo-Fence after the ignition is turned off.
menu3.Description: 0: Disable auto trigger mode.|21: Auto parking fence. Automatically set up Geo-Fence after ignition off. |22: Manual parking fence. Manually enable Geo-Fence after ignition off. |

menu2.name: PEO (Polygon Geo-Fence Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEO is used to configure the parameters for Polygon Geo-Fence (Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter on a geographic area using a location-based service.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|

menu2.name: RMD (Roaming Detection Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRMD is used to configure the parameters for network roaming detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Only detect which operator list the device is currently registered with|2: When the detection device is registered in the blocked operator list

menu2.name: SPD (Speed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a speed range for the speed alarm function of the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable speed alarm|1: Report speed alarmif the current speed is within the speed range defined by <Min. Speed> and <Max. Speed>|2: Report speed alarmif the current speed is outside the speed range defined by <Min. Speed> and <Max. Speed>|3: Report speed alarm only once if the current speed is within/outside the speed range defined by <Min. Speed> and <Max. Speed>.
menu3.Description: 0: Disable speed alarm|1: Report speed alarmif the current speed is within the speed range defined by <Min. Speed> and <Max. Speed>|2: Report speed alarmif the current speed is outside the speed range defined by <Min. Speed> and <Max. Speed>|3: Report speed alarm only once if the current speed is within/outside the speed range defined by <Min. Speed> and <Max. Speed>. In this mode, <Send Interval> will be ignored|

menu2.name: IDL (Excessive Idling Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDL is used to detect the engine excessive idling (Vehicle stays stationary while the ignition is on).

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: HBM (Harsh Behavior Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHBM is used to monitor the harsh driving behavior based on GNSS or motion sensor.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Detected by GNSS only|2: Detected by motion sensor only|3: Detected by motion sensor or GNSS|4: Detected by motion sensor and GNSS|5: Enable this function: Detection by XYZ-axis acceleration data only
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function.|1: Enable this function: Detection by GNSS only.|2: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor only.|3: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor or GNSS.|4: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor and GNSS.|5: Enable this function: Detection by XYZ-axis acceleration data only.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Discard Unknow Alarm|1: Discard Unknow Alarm|

0: Disable calibration of XYZ-axis|1: Positive X-axis of the device|2: Positive Y-axis of the device|3: Positive Z-axis of the device|4: Negative X-axis of the device| 5: Negative Y-axis of the device|6: Negative Z-axis of the device|7: Enable 3-axis self-calibration.
1: Positive X-axis of the device|2: Positive Y-axis of the device|3: Positive Z-axis of the device|4: Negative X-axis of the device|5: Negative Y-axis of the device|6: Negative Z-axis of the device.
0: Disable|1: Enable

menu2.name: SSR (Start/Stop Report)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSSR is used to detect the status of vehicle (Start or Stop status).

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: The unit is minute|1: The unit is second
0: Last known GNSS position|1: Real time GNSS position

menu2.name: JDC (Jamming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJDC is used to configure the parameters for jamming detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report +RESP:GTJDR upon entering into jamming state.|2: Report +RESP:GTJDS upon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable jamming detection function.|1: Enable jamming detection function. If jamming is detected, the device will report the +RESP:GTJDR message upon entering into jamming state.|2: Enable jamming detection function. If jamming is detected, the device will report the +RESP:GTJDS message upon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|

menu2.name: CRA (Crash Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCRA is used to configure the parameters for crash detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Enable this function. In this mode, three-axis self-calibration is not needed|2: Enable this function. In this mode, the acceleration sensor data will be converted in accordance with three-axis self-calibration.
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function|1: Enable this function. In this mode, three-axis self-calibration is not needed|2: Enable this function. In this mode, the acceleration sensor data will be converted in accordance with three-axis self-calibration.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Start Sampling After power on|1: Start Sampling After ignition on|
0: Do not include gyroscope sampling data in the message +RESP:GTCRD|1: Include gyroscope sampling data in the message +RESP:GTCRD
0: Do not report the +RESP:GTPGR message|1: Report the +RESP:GTPGR message when the crash accident is detected

menu2.name: ASC (Three-Axis Self-Calibration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTASC is used to define the condition for the calibration of the accelerometer directions.

menu2.name: ROD (Rollover Detection)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTROD command is used to configure the parameter for rollover detection. According to the working mode, the device will report +RESP:GTROD message to backend server when the rollover event is detected.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the rollover detection function|1: Enable the rollover detection function

1: Positive X-axis of the device| 2: Positive Y-axis of the device| 3: Positive Z-axis of the device| 4: Negative X-axis of the device| 5: Negative Y-axis of the device| 6: Negative Z-axis of the device|

menu2.name: EPS (External Power Supply Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEPS is used to configure the parameters for external power supply monitoring.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable the external power supply monitoring function. |1:If the current voltage is within the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered.|2:If the current voltage is outside the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered.
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the external power supply monitoring function.|1:Enable the external power supply monitoring function. If the current voltage is within the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered|2: Enable the external power supply monitoring function. If the current voltage is outside the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered

menu2.name: CAN(CANBUS Device Configuration)
menu2.Description2: This command AT+GTCAN is used to set the CANBUS device configuration for reporting CANBUS device information (+RESP:GTCAN) which mainly contains VIN, vehicle speed, engine speed, engine coolant temperature and other information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Enable this function

VIN|Ignition Key|Total Distance|Total Fuel Used|Vehicle Speed|Engine RPM|Engine Coolant Temperature|Fuel Consumption|Fuel Level|Range|Accelerator Pedal Pressure|Total Engine Hours|Total Driving Time|Total Engine Idle Time|Total Idle Fuel Used|Axle Weight 2nde|Tachograph Information|Detailed Information / Indicators|Lights|Doors|Total Vehicle Overspeed Time|Total Vehicle Engine Overspeed Time|Total Distance Impulses|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|CAN Report Expansion Mask|GNSS Information|GSM Information
0: Ignore all additional events|1: By ignition on/off event
1: Communication with BLE

Ad-Blue Level|Axle Weight 1st|Axle Weight 3rd|Axle Weight 4th|Tachograph Overspeed Signal|Tachograph Vehicle Motion Signal|Tachograph Driving Direction|Analog Input Value|Engine Braking Factor|Pedal Braking Factor|Total Accelerator Kick-downs|Total Effective Engine Speed Time|Total Cruise Control Time|Total Accelerator Kick-down Time|Total Brake Applications|Tachograph Driver 1 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 2 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 1 Name|Tachograph Driver 2 Name|Registration Number|Expansion Information|Rapid Brakings|Rapid Accelerations|Rapid Accelerations|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

menu2.name: CLT(CANBUS Alarm Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCLT command is used to set alarm threshold of CANBUS data. The AT+GTCLT can support 20 CANBUS alarm groups at most.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the CAN alarm function|1: Enable the CAN alarm function

VIN|Ignition Key|Total Distance|Total Fuel Used|Vehicle Speed|Engine RPM|Engine Coolant Temperature|Fuel Consumption|Fuel Level|Range|Accelerator Pedal Pressure|Total Engine Hours|Total Driving Time|Total Engine Idle Time|Total Idle Fuel Used|Axle Weight 2nd|Tachograph Information|Detailed Information/Indicators|Lights|Doors|Total Vehicle Overspeed Time|Total Vehicle Overspeed Time|Total Distance Impulses|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|CAN Report Expansion Mask|Reserved|Reserved

FL – fuel low indicator (1 – indicator on, 0 – off)|DS – driver seatbelt indicator (1 – indicator on, 0 – off)|AC – air conditioning (1 – on, 0 - off)|CC – cruise control (1 – active, 0 - disabled)|B – brake pedal (1 – pressed; 0 – released)|C – clutch pedal (1 – pressed; 0 – released)|H – handbrake (1 – pulled-up, 0 – released)|CL – central lock (1 – locked, 0 – unlocked)|R – reverse gear (1 – on, 0 – off)|RL – running lights (1 – on, 0 – off)|LB – low beams (1 – on, 0 – off)|HB – high beams (1 – on, 0 – off)|RFL – rear fog lights (1 – on, 0 – off)|FFL – front fog lights (1 – on, 0 – off)|D – doors (1 – any door opened, 0 – all doors closed)|T – trunk (1 – opened, 0 – closed)|W – webcast (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|BFL – brake fluid low indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|CLL – coolant level low indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|BAT– battery indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|BF – brake system failure indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|OP – oil pressure indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|EH – engine hot indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|ABS – ABS failure indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|Reserved|CHK –“check engine” indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|AIR – airbags indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|SC – service call indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|OLL – oil level low indicator (1 – on, 0 – off or not available)|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

Running Lights (1 – on, 0 – off)|Low Beam (1 – on, 0 – off)|High Beam (1 – on, 0 – off)|Front Fog Light (1 – on, 0 – off)|Rear Fog Light (1 – on, 0 – off)|Hazard Lights (1 – on, 0 – off)|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Driver Door (1 – opened, 0 – closed)|Passenger Door (1 – opened, 0 – closed)|Rear Left Door (1 – opened, 0 – closed)|Rear Right Door (1 – opened, 0 – closed)|Trunk (1 – opened, 0 – closed)|Hood (1 – opened, 0 – closed)|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

Under Low RPM Event (1 – Triggered, 0 – not triggered)|Over Low RPM Event (1 – Triggered, 0 – not triggered)|Under High RPM Event (1 – Triggered, 0 – not triggered)|Over High RPM Event (1 – Triggered, 0 – not triggered)|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|

Ad-Blue Level|Axle Weight 1st|Axle Weight 3rd|Axle Weight 4th|Tachograph Overspeed Signal|Tachograph Vehicle Motion Signal|Tachograph Driving Direction|Analog Input Value|Engine Braking Factor|Pedal Braking Factor|Total Accelerator Kick-downs|Total Effective Engine Speed Time|Total Cruise Control Time|Total Accelerator Kick-down Time|Total Accelerator Kick-down Time|Tachograph Driver 1 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 2 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 1 Name|Tachograph Driver 2 Name|Registration Number|Expansion Information|Rapid Brakings|Rapid Brakings|Engine Torque|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

menu2.name: VMS (Virtual Ignition Mode Selection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVMS is used to configure the mode of detecting ignition state.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the virtual ignition detection function|2: Voltage virtual ignition detection mode|4: Accelerometer (motion status) virtual ignition detection mode|7: Combined detection mode
Voltage virtual ignition detection|Motion status virtual ignition detection|
Voltage virtual ignition detection|Motion status virtual ignition detection|
0: AND logic.|1: OR logic.|
menu3.Description: 0: AND logic. All bits matched are considered as ignition on event.|1: OR logic. Any one bit matched is considered as ignition on event.|

menu2.name: VVS (Voltage Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVVS is used to configure parameters for checking ignition state by voltage.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the smart voltage adjustment algorithm. The values of <Ignition On Voltage> and <Voltage Offset> will keep static.|1: Enable the smart voltage adjustment algorithm. The values of <Ignition On Voltage> and <Voltage Offset> will dynamically change according to the actual ignition on and off voltage.|

menu2.name: AVS（Accelerometer (Motion Status) Virtual Ignition Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAVS is used to configure parameters for detecting ignition status based on motion status.

menu2.name: BTS (Bluetooth Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBTS is used to configure Bluetooth settings for the device to report certain events.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

Device information service that includes the manufacturer name and the model number.|Battery Service that includes the battery level.|Virtual Serial Port Service. The data will be transmitted over virtual serial port connection in this service.
0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General Discoverable After Igintion On|2: General Discoverable After Igintion Off|3: General Discoverable After Power On|
menu3.Description: 0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after the ignition is turned on|2: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after the ignition is turned off|3: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after it is powered on|

menu3.RangeMx: Name|MAC Address|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Peer Role|Reserved|Peer Address Type|Peer MAC Address|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
0: Standard Power.|1: High Power.

0: -18 dBm (Standard Power), -14 dBm (High Power)|1: -15 dBm (Standard Power), -11 dBm (High Power)|2: -12 dBm (Standard Power), -8 dBm (High Power)|3: -9 dBm (Standard Power), -5 dBm (High Power)|4: -6 dBm (Standard Power), -2 dBm (High Power)|5: -2 dBm (Standard Power), 2 dBm (High Power)|6: 0 dBm (Standard Power), 4 dBm (High Power)|7: 5 dBm (Standard Power), 8 dBm (High Power)
0: Bluetooth Name|1: Eddystone-UID
0: Use the BLE MAC as the Beacon ID|1: The custom Beacon ID

menu2.name: BMS(Bluetooth Driver Identification)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBMS is used to configure the peripherals which the device will connect to and read the data from. Once the device connects to the peripheral, it will try to search the Service by UUID and read the data from specified Characteristic.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable

Service information which includes <Service UUID Type> and <Service UUID>| Characteristic information which includes <Characteristic UUID Type> and <Characteristic UUID>|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved
1: 16-bit UUID|2: 128-bit UUID
1: 16-bit UUID|2: 128-bit UUID.
0: Do not need PIN code|1: Need PIN code for pairing
0: Raw data received from Bluetooth|1: Hexadecimal format.

menu2.name: BID (Bluetooth Beacon ID Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBID is used for the device to scan Bluetooth beacon accessories.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: WKF300|2: ID ELA|3: WID300|4: WID310|5: Eddstone|6: WID320|
Reserved|Accessory MAC|Reserved|Accessory Battery Level|Reserved|Reserved|Signal Strength|Beacon Type and Beacon Data|
0: No push the WKF300|1:Push the WKF300|
0: Disable Keyfob detection.|3:Enable Keyfob detection: Allow the device to scan only once.
0: Disable|1: Enable
0: Disable.|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID300 continuously. |3: Allow the device to scan continuously. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable.|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID300 continuously. |3: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. The +RESP:GTBID message is sent to the backend server periodically according to the parameter <WID300 IGN Report Interval>/<WID300 IGF Report Interval>. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID310 continuously. |3: Allow the device to scan continuously. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable.|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID310 continuously. |3: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. The +RESP:GTBID message is sent to the backend server periodically according to the parameter <WID310 IGN Report Interval>/<WID310 IGF Report Interval>. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable
0: Disable detection|2: Enable detection:Allow the device to scan continuously|3: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan continuously

menu2.name: BAS (Bluetooth Accessory Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBAS is used for the device to scan or connect with Bluetooth accessories in order to obtain data.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No Bluetooth accessory|4: CAN accessory|6: Multi-functional beacon sensor|8: External Input Output Bluetooth Accessory|12: BLE TPMS sensor|13: Relay Bluetooth Accessory
0: CAN100 BLE|2: WTH300|3: RHT ELA|4: WMS301|5: WTH301

Accessory Name|Accessory MAC|Accessory Status|Accessory Battery Level|Accessory Temperature|Accessory Humidity|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Tire pressure|Reserved|Enhanced Temperature |Reserved|Reserved|Relay Data|Reserved|

0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable temperature alarm.|1: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is within the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|2: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is outside the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|3: Report temperature alarm only once if the current temperature enters or exits the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report humidity alarm within the humidity range.|2: Report humidity alarm outside the humidity range.|3: Report humidity alarm only onceenters or exits the humidity range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable humidity alarm.|1: Report humidity alarm if the current humidity is within the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>.|2: Report humidity alarm if the current humidity is outside the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>.|3: Report humidity alarm only once if the current humidity enters or exits the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable tire pressure alarm|1: Report tire pressure alarm if the current tire pressure is within the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>|2: Report tire pressure alarm if the current tire pressure is outside the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>|3: Report tire pressure alarm only once if the current tire pressure enters/exits the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>. In this mode, <Send Interval> will be ignored
0: Disable.|1: Enable.|

menu2.name: UDT (UART Data Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUDT is used for the device to transfer data to Bluetooth.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable data transfer|1: Reserved|2: Enable data transfer to Bluetooth virtual serial port

Activated GEO|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved

Protocol Version, Firmware Version|Hardware Version|Unique ID|Device Name|Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Network Data, Reserved|Mileage|HMC|GSV Number|Circular GEO Status|Reserved|Motion Status|External Power VCC, Backup Battery Level, Charging|Circular GEO Status Mask|Reserved|Reserved|Send Time|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
0: Disable the report of those messages configured by <Report BLE Mask>|1: Enable the report of those messages configured by <Report BLE Mask>

menu2.name: DAT (Transparent Data Transmission)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDAT is used to transfer data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Send message to the backend server with +RESP:GTDAT (Short Format).|2: Send message to the backend server with +RESP:GTDAT (Long Format)|4: Send the pure data directly to the Bluetooth|5: Send the pure data directly to the Bluetooth without CRLF

menu2.name: SVR (Primary Stolen Vehicle Recovery)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSVR is used to configure the Bluetooth settings for the Primary device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Enable this function

menu2.name: IEX (Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIEX is used to configure the parameters of external Bluetooth Input accessories.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting
0: Disable this function|5: means that Bluetooth accessory Input 1 is enabled|

menu2.name: AEX (Analog Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAEX is used to configure the parameters of External Bluetooth Analog Input accessories.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Bluetooth Analog Input|

0: Disable|1: If the current input voltage is within the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|2: If the current input voltage is outside the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: Enable analog input alarm: If the current input voltage is within the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|2: Enable analog input alarm: If the current input voltage is outside the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|

menu2.name: OEX (Output Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTOEX command is used to output wave shape 1 on EIO100 output.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting.|

menu2.name: BSF (Bluetooth Specific Format Scan)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBSF is used for the device to scan Bluetooth beacon accessories with specific advertising data. To use this function, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be set to 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Allow the device to scan beacon continuously
1: Allow the device to scan iBeacon with specific <UUID>

menu2.name: RTO (Real Time Operation)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTO is used to retrieve information from the terminal or control the terminal when it executes certain actions.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Get the GNSS related information|1: RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately|2: READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM.|3: Reboot the terminal.|4: RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings.|5: PWROFF. Power off the device when external power supply is not connected.|6: CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID.|7: CSQ. Get the current signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ.|8: VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER.|9: BAT. Get the external adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT.|10: CAN. Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN.|B: TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ.|C: GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM.|D: DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports.|E: GSV. Request the device to report the GPS/GLONASS fix level.|14: BLE. Commands for Bluetooth|1C: ATI. Get the basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI.|22: CAN100 Operation. Set car model for CAN100 or read car model from CAN100.|25: SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status.|3A: RLY. Set the state of the WRL300.
0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 1: RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 2: READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM
4: RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Light|1: Heavy

menu3.groupname: 5: PWROFF. Power off the device when external power supply is not connected.
6: CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 7: CSQ. Get the current signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 8: VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 9: BAT. Get the external adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 10: CAN. Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: B: TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: C: GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: D: DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: E: GSV. Request the device to report the GPS/GLONASS fix level.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 1C:ATI. Get the basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI
menu3.RangeMx: Firmware Version|MCU Version|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Modem Firmware Version|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Hardware Version|Modem Hardware Version|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Sensor ID|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 22: CAN100 Operation. Set car model for CAN100 or read car model from CAN100.
menu3.RangeMx: 0: Read the current car model and report it via the message +RESP:GTCML|1: Set car model|2: Start CAN100 automatic synchronization
0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 25: SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status.
menu3.RangeMx: 0:Read self-calibration status.|1:Clear self-calibration status.|
0: The message will be output to the backend server|1: The message will be output to the main serial port|3: If the command is received via SMS

menu3.groupname: 3A:RLY. Set the state of the WRL300.
menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable relay of WRL300, relay NC pin switch to relay COM pin.|1: Enable relay of WRL300, relay NO pin switch to relay COM pin.

menu2.name: HMC (Hour Meter Count)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHMC is used to measure the accumulated use time with each actuation of the ignition on.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the hour meter count function|1: Enable the hour meter count function.|

menu2.name: WLT (Allowed Number List Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWLT is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to perform the SMS function.

menu3.RangeMx: Reserved|Reserved|Allowlist for SMS

menu2.name: CMD (Command String Storage)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMD command is used to store the commands which will be used by the command AT+GTUDF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete command.|1: Add command.|

menu2.name: UDF (User Defined Function)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUDF is used to bind input events and stored commands.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable The Event Group.|1: Enable The Event Group|2: Delete The Event Group|

Power on finished |Ignition on |Ignition off |Attached to the EGPRS/LTE network |Not attached to the EGPRS/LTE network |Registered on the EGPRS/LTE network |Not registered on the EGPRS/LTE network |Network roaming |Network non-roaming |SIM card is locked |GNSS is on |GNSS is off |The device is stationary |The device is moving |Reserved |Reserved |Reserved |Reserved |Reserved |Reserved |Reserved |Reserved |Reserved |SIM card is not inserted |Reserved |Reserved |Inside the speed range |Outside the speed range |Messages need to be sent |No messages need to be sent

Inside the Geo 0|Inside the Geo 1|Inside the Geo 2|Inside the Geo 3|Inside the Geo 4|Inside the Geo 5|Inside the Geo 6|Inside the Geo 7|Inside the Geo 8|Inside the Geo 9|Inside the Geo 10|Inside the Geo 11|Inside the Geo 12|Inside the Geo 13|Inside the Geo 14|Inside the Geo 15|Inside the Geo 16|Inside the Geo 17|Inside the Geo 18|Inside the Geo 19|

Outside the Geo 0|Outside the Geo 1|Outside the Geo 2|Outside the Geo 3|Outside the Geo 4|Outside the Geo 5|Outside the Geo 6|Outside the Geo 7|Outside the Geo 8|Outside the Geo 9|Outside the Geo 10|Outside the Geo 11|Outside the Geo 12|Outside the Geo 13|Outside the Geo 14|Outside the Geo 15|Outside the Geo 16|Outside the Geo 17|Outside the Geo 18|Outside the Geo 19|

Stocmd ID Mask 0|Stocmd ID Mask 1|Stocmd ID Mask 2|Stocmd ID Mask 3|Stocmd ID Mask 4|Stocmd ID Mask 5|Stocmd ID Mask 6|Stocmd ID Mask 7|Stocmd ID Mask 8|Stocmd ID Mask 9|Stocmd ID Mask 10|Stocmd ID Mask 11|Stocmd ID Mask 12|Stocmd ID Mask 13|Stocmd ID Mask 14|Stocmd ID Mask 15|Stocmd ID Mask 16|Stocmd ID Mask 17|Stocmd ID Mask 18|Stocmd ID Mask 19|Stocmd ID Mask 20|Stocmd ID Mask 21|Stocmd ID Mask 22|Stocmd ID Mask 23|Stocmd ID Mask 24|Stocmd ID Mask 25|Stocmd ID Mask 26|Stocmd ID Mask 27|Stocmd ID Mask 28|Stocmd ID Mask 29|Stocmd ID Mask 30|Stocmd ID Mask 31|
menu3.Description: Note: The maximum number of the stored commands to be excuted in a group is five

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not send an acknowledgement message when a stored command is executed.|1: Send an acknowledgement message when a stored command is executed.|

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Peo 0|Inside the Peo 1|Inside the Peo 2|Inside the Peo 3|Inside the Peo 4|Inside the Peo 5|Inside the Peo 6|Inside the Peo 7|Inside the Peo 8|Inside the Peo 9|Inside the Peo 10|Inside the Peo 11|Inside the Peo 12|Inside the Peo 13|Inside the Peo 14|Inside the Peo 15|Inside the Peo 16|Inside the Peo 17|Inside the Peo 18|Inside the Peo 19|

Outside the Peo 0|Outside the Peo 1|Outside the Peo 2|Outside the Peo 3|Outside the Peo 4|Outside the Peo 5|Outside the Peo 6|Outside the Peo 7|Outside the Peo 8|Outside the Peo 9|Outside the Peo 10|Outside the Peo 11|Outside the Peo 12|Outside the Peo 13|Outside the Peo 14|Outside the Peo 15|Outside the Peo 16|Outside the Peo 17|Outside the Peo 18|Outside the Peo 19|

menu2.name: OWL (Operator List Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWL is used to configure a white or forbidden list of operators to allow GPRS connection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: White list configuration|2: Forbidden list configuration

menu2.name: GAM (GNSS-assisted Motion Measurement)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGAM is used for assisting in measuring motion with GNSS if the sensor detects stationary state while the vehicle is ignition on.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: FVR (Configuration File Version)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFVR is used to record configuration information from the configuration file (generated by Manage Tool) to be downloaded by the device during update via AT+GTUPC.

menu3.Description: Range of parameters 0000 – 9999
